segments.en: Linked Discourses 22
1. Nakula’s Father
8. Anxiety Because of Grasping (2nd)
At Sāvatthī.
“Mendicants, I will teach you how grasping leads to anxiety, and how not grasping leads to freedom from anxiety.
Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.
And how does grasping lead to anxiety?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano rūpaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati.
segments.en: It’s when an uneducated ordinary person regards form like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ rūpaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti.
segments.en: But that form of theirs decays and perishes,
which gives rise to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
They regard feeling …
perception …
choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati.
segments.en: consciousness like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ viññāṇaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti.
segments.en: But that consciousness of theirs decays and perishes,
which gives rise to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
That’s how grasping leads to anxiety.
And how does not grasping lead to freedom from anxiety?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
segments.en: It’s when an educated noble disciple regards form like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ rūpaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti.
segments.en: When that form of theirs decays and perishes,
it doesn’t give rise to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
They regard feeling …
perception …
choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
segments.en: consciousness like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ viññāṇaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti.
segments.en: When that consciousness of theirs decays and perishes,
it doesn’t give rise to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
That’s how not grasping leads to freedom from anxiety.”

suttaplex.blurb: An ordinary person identifies their self with the five aggregates and suffers anxiety when the aggregates change. But a noble disciple, free of such identification, does not suffer.
